title: What versions of MStore are supported?
text: In a nutshell, if your MStore version is up to date (not more than 12 months old), you will get the best user experience, and full support. TABLE OF CONTENTS Version Lifecycle Are There any Upgrade Costs? How to Request an Upgrade Version Lifecycle The general version support policy is that customers should be using a release that is less than 12 months old (i.e. it's less than one year after the release date documented in the MStore Release Notes). The benefits of this are: You can take advantage of new features. Have fixes for faults found by our software development and testing team, and by other customers (which you may not experience, or may not know you've experienced). Performance and/or usability may be enhanced. The latest MStore version will be tested on the latest supported versions and service packs of the Windows Operating System (see What Operating Systems is the MStore Back Office Supported On? ) Note that if your server is not not compatible with the above, K3 can host your MStore server in our cloud if you do not want to upgrade your operating system and hardware. Unless in exceptional circumstances, we do not apply patches to existing versions, we fix in the latest version and upgrade you to that version. There are some elements of MStore such as the website, reports or database code/fixes which may be updated separately to fix an issue without an MStore back office and POS upgrade. If your version is older than 12 months, we will only provide support for confirmed P1 and P2 Incidents in the core MStore POS and database/backend software (which may still require an upgrade to fix). All support requests which are not related to a possible fault or superseded functionality in the out of date core software will still be dealt with as normal. Are There any Upgrade Costs? There is no charge for the upgraded software when you have a current subscription (except chargeable modules which you have not previously purchased). Effort required from K3 to do an upgrade The effort required to upgrade your system to fix significant faults you have experienced is free of charge as long as it's during normal business hours (9-5:30 weekdays excluding public holidays). Your subscription also entitles you to one free functional upgrade per year during normal business hours (e.g. if you want to take advantage of new features and/or make sure that your version is no more than 12 months old). The time spent installing an upgrade is chargeable if it's required to be done out of normal business hours (agreed upon request), or if more than one functional upgrade is requested in a year. An upgrade typically takes 1-2 hours, but varies according to complexity and size of you system architecture. How to Request an Upgrade If you're not sure what version you have, please see How to check what version of MStore you are using. Please raise a service request on the support portal as shown in the example below. The upgrade steps can be found in MStore Core System Upgrade Process which describes what customers and K3 need to do.

Version Lifecycle

The general version support policy is that customers should be using a release that is less than 12 months old (i.e. it's less than one year after the release date documented in the MStore Release Notes).


The benefits of this are:

  • You can take advantage of new features.
  • Have fixes for faults found by our software development and testing team, and by other customers (which you may not experience, or may not know you've experienced).
  • Performance and/or usability may be enhanced.
  • The latest MStore version will be tested on the latest supported versions and service packs of the Windows Operating System (see What Operating Systems is the MStore Back Office Supported On? )
    • Note that if your server is not not compatible with the above, K3 can host your MStore server in our cloud if you do not want to upgrade your operating system and hardware.


Unless in exceptional circumstances, we do not apply patches to existing versions, we fix in the latest version and upgrade you to that version. There are some elements of MStore such as the website, reports or database code/fixes which may be updated separately to fix an issue without an MStore back office and POS upgrade.


If your version is older than 12 months, we will only provide support for confirmed P1 and P2 Incidents in the core MStore POS and database/backend software (which may still require an upgrade to fix).

All support requests which are not related to a possible fault or superseded functionality in the out of date core software will still be dealt with as normal.



Are There any Upgrade Costs?

There is no charge for the upgraded software when you have a current subscription (except chargeable modules which you have not previously purchased).


Effort required from K3 to do an upgrade

  • The effort required to upgrade your system to fix significant faults you have experienced is free of charge as long as it's during normal business hours (9-5:30 weekdays excluding public holidays).
  • Your subscription also entitles you to one free functional upgrade per year during normal business hours (e.g. if you want to take advantage of new features and/or make sure that your version is no more than 12 months old).

 

The time spent installing an upgrade is chargeable if it's required to be done out of normal business hours (agreed upon request), or if more than one functional upgrade is requested in a year. An upgrade typically takes 1-2 hours, but varies according to complexity and size of you system architecture.


How to Request an Upgrade

If you're not sure what version you have, please see How to check what version of MStore you are using.

The upgrade steps can be found in MStore Core System Upgrade Process which describes what customers and K3 need to do.

title: What Operating Systems is the MStore POS and Back Office Supported On?
text: MStore POS and Back Office is supported on the following Windows operating systems: ✅ Windows 10 Note that Windows 10 will not be supported by Microsoft from 14th October 2025 - see Windows 10 Home and Pro - Microsoft Lifecycle This means that security updates will no longer be available which increases the risk of malware/hacking of your computer. Microsoft have an Extended Security Updates program which is chargeable for most customers - see Extended Security Updates (ESU) program for Windows 10 | Microsoft Learn Note that there is a longer term supported version of Windows 10, but it's designed for devices such as a Point Of Sale, not for normal- use laptops and desktop machines Windows Enterprise LTSC overview | Microsoft Learn ✅ Windows 11 This is the recommended operating system ✅ Windows Server 2016 Note that Server 2016 is out of mainstream support (since 11th Jan 2022) and its extended support phase ends 12th Jan 2027 Windows Server 2016 - Microsoft Lifecycle ) ✅ Windows Server 2019 Note that Server 2019 is out of mainstream support (since 9th Jan 2024) and its extended support phase ends 9th Jan 2029 Windows Server 2019 - Microsoft Lifecycle ✅ Windows Server 2022 - information on Windows Server 2022 - Microsoft Lifecycle This is the recommended operating system General Policy If Microsoft withdraw mainstream support for an operating system, we will also withdraw general support for it at that time on the basis that if a fault arises in MStore, we can't test any fixes on an unsupported operating system. It may be possible to continue supporting outdated Windows versions for a limited time, but this would be at an increased cost to reflect the increased cost of purchasing additional support from Microsoft.

If Microsoft withdraw mainstream support for an operating system, we will also withdraw general support for it at that time on the basis that if a fault arises in MStore, we can't test any fixes on an unsupported operating system.

title: MStore Core System Upgrade Process
text: The general upgrade policy and lifecycle for MStore can be found on What versions of MStore are supported? including what triggers an upgrade to be done. The "MStore Core System" refers to the MStore database, Back Office, and Till/POS programs. Overview We will schedule a day and time with you to do the upgrade which needs to be when you do not need to use the POS/tills. If there is not already a support ticket for this, we will raise one to capture all communications regarding the upgrade. The upgrade is done on the MStore database server first, and then all tills and PCs pull down the update when they are restarted. If there are any tills online, we will connect onto a couple to make sure that the new version has been installed correctly. We will then let you check and confirm that the others have been updated successfully. Server Upgrade The database server upgrade is done first, and is carried out by K3 who will: Log onto your database server using Team Viewer. Take a backup of your database. Running a database upgrade script (which, as applicable, will add and change stored procedures, amend or add additional tables and fields as needed. Copy across new files to be "blobbed" into the database and authorised via MStore to send to tills and computers running our software. Recreate the till data file, so the latest data and files are sent to all the tills when they restart. Back Office and Till Upgrade How to Trigger the Upgrade Once the server upgrade is complete, the upgrade on all tills and machines running the MStore Back Office can be triggered in any of the following ways: Restart the machine (preferred/safest method). Note that tablets will need to be powered off and on again (usually by pressing and holding the power button - just a single press puts the table into standby mode and does not restart it) Restart the Windows Service "MeracUpdater" For tills, you can click on this button Technical Details There is a windows service called "MeracUpdater" that runs on start-up. This detects if there is a newer version and if so applies this to the computer. The update normally takes 20-30 seconds and will likely already happened by the time a computer boots up and is ready to use. There is no reason to keep computers on to receive the update. Leaving one or two tills allow us to make sure those specific tills do update when we try the above. There are 3 things that could prevent the update. During the original installation of the MStore software, full permissions will have been set over the path "C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac" for all users. If this isn’t set then it will prevent the software being overwritten with newer files. The MStore software has been left open. You can’t overwrite a file if it is open. Computers being restarted prevents this. The computer is running the wrong version of the updater process (unlikely). If any computers fail to update, we recommend a reboot. If the update has still not been downloaded, please let K3 Support know, as they will need to dial into the affected computer and check the setup and fix. Rollback In the rare circumstances when an upgrade does not work as expected, the rollback process is very dependent on the situation, but the general process is as follows: K3 will investigate the cause to find out if it's setup/data-related, giving a workaround if possible. In agreement with you, we would generally allow a maximum of 1 hour before moving to the next step if the issue is preventing trading. K3 to reinstall the previous version of the software as a temporary measure via the same process above, where we deem this to be a program issue. Therefore restarting tills/PCs will pull down the desired version. K3 will use the previous database backup to refer back to and help investigate issues that had occurred between your previous version and the latest version. Once the rollback is complete, we would work as top priority to find the cause of the issue and provide a fix.

The general upgrade policy and lifecycle for MStore can be found on What versions of MStore are supported? including what triggers an upgrade to be done.


The "MStore Core System" refers to the MStore database, Back Office, and Till/POS programs.


Overview

We will schedule a day and time with you to do the upgrade which needs to be when you do not need to use the POS/tills. If there is not already a support ticket for this, we will raise one to capture all communications regarding the upgrade.


The upgrade is done on the MStore database server first, and then all tills and PCs pull down the update when they are restarted. 


If there are any tills online, we will connect onto a couple to make sure that the new version has been installed correctly. We will then let you check and confirm that the others have been updated successfully.


Server Upgrade

The database server upgrade is done first, and is carried out by K3 who will:

  1. Log onto your database server using Team Viewer.
  2. Take a backup of your database.
  3. Running a database upgrade script (which, as applicable, will add and change stored procedures, amend or add additional tables and fields as needed.
  4. Copy across new files to be "blobbed" into the database and authorised via MStore to send to tills and computers running our software.
  5. Recreate the till data file, so the latest data and files are sent to all the tills when they restart.


Back Office and Till Upgrade

How to Trigger the Upgrade

Once the server upgrade is complete, the upgrade on all tills and machines running the MStore Back Office can be triggered in any of the following ways:

  1. Restart the machine (preferred/safest method).
    Note that tablets will need to be powered off and on again (usually by pressing and holding the power button - just a single press puts the table into standby mode and does not restart it)
  2. Restart the Windows Service "MeracUpdater"
  3. For tills, you can click on this button


Technical Details

There is a windows service called "MeracUpdater" that runs on start-up. This detects if there is a newer version and if so applies this to the computer. The update normally takes 20-30 seconds and will likely already happened by the time a computer boots up and is ready to use. There is no reason to keep computers on to receive the update. Leaving one or two tills allow us to make sure those specific tills do update when we try the above. There are 3 things that could prevent the update.

  1. During the original installation of the MStore software, full permissions will have been set over the path "C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac" for all users. If this isn’t set then it will prevent the software being overwritten with newer files.
  2. The MStore software has been left open. You can’t overwrite a file if it is open. Computers being restarted prevents this.
  3. The computer is running the wrong version of the updater process (unlikely).

If any computers fail to update, we recommend a reboot. If the update has still not been downloaded, please let K3 Support know, as they will need to dial into the affected computer and check the setup and fix.


Rollback

In the rare circumstances when an upgrade does not work as expected, the rollback process is very dependent on the situation, but the general process is as follows:

  1. K3 will investigate the cause to find out if it's setup/data-related, giving a workaround if possible. In agreement with you, we would generally allow a maximum of 1 hour before moving to the next step if the issue is preventing trading.
  2. K3 to reinstall the previous version of the software as a temporary measure via the same process above, where we deem this to be a program issue. Therefore restarting tills/PCs will pull down the desired version.
  3. K3 will use the previous database backup to refer back to and help investigate issues that had occurred between your previous version and the latest version.


Once the rollback is complete, we would work as top priority to find the cause of the issue and provide a fix.

title: Tips to keep your self-hosted MStore database performing at its best
text: K3 hosts many customers' databases, but if you host your own database, here are some tips on databases maintenance best practices which will help to make sure that you don't experience performance issues (e.g. slow reports) caused by a lack of database maintenance. MStore uses Microsoft SQL Server for it’s database which is a transactional database with a lot of data is written to it and updated on it. To prevent issues when retrieving data it is very important to keep the database healthy using a scheduled maintenance plan in SQL server. The following points are advised to address this: Perform data integrity checks Regularly checking the consistency of your databases helps ensure data integrity. SQL Server provides commands such as DBCC CHECKDB to detect and repair integrity issues in the database. Maintain indexes Indexes are crucial for query performance. Over time, indexes can become fragmented, leading to decreased performance. SQL Server provides maintenance tasks such as rebuilding or reorganizing indexes to optimize their performance. Regular index maintenance should be scheduled to keep your database running efficiently. Update statistics SQL Server uses statistics to generate optimal query execution plans. Outdated or inaccurate statistics can lead to suboptimal query performance. SQL Server automatically updates statistics, but in some cases, manual updates may be necessary, especially on large tables or after significant data changes. Monitor disk space and clean up data Monitoring disk space is critical to prevent data loss and maintain database performance. Regularly check disk space usage on the server hosting your SQL Server databases and ensure that you have adequate space for backup files, transaction logs and database growth. Implement data archiving and cleanup processes to remove obsolete or unnecessary data from databases. Restrict Memory Usage You might want to limit the amount of memory which SQL Server uses on a machine because if it's allowed to use all memory, this can have adverse effects. Back up databases and transaction logs It’s important to take regular backups and test them periodically. Be sure to follow retention policies for backup files. Is your Database on a Fit-For-Purpose Server? If the above tips do not solve the issue, please check if your server is up to date enough (i.e .not more than 5 years old), and is it hosting anything else? Is your server running one of the supported versions of Windows - see What Operating Systems is the MStore Back Office Supported On? Do you need help with this? If this all seems too technical and you need help, we can host your database for you, but we can also remotely manage your database running on your own server. For more information on hosting, please contact your customer success manager. For more information on K3 helping you manage your database, please see the options in K3 MStore Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan.

title: K3 MStore Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS What is Database Optimisation? Why Optimise Your K3 Application Database? Who Is Responsible? How Can K3 Help? K3’s Experts Steps to an Optimised Database Additional Options Database Backups Disaster Recovery Testing Archiving Next Steps What is Database Optimisation? Database optimisation is the process of using various database manufacturer tools to fine tune their efficiency and maximise the speed at which it works. The tools need configuring, monitoring, and the results evaluated to achieve this. Why Optimise Your K3 Application Database? In a dynamic business landscape, ensuring fast and reliable application responses from your database infrastructure is paramount. K3 applications have a database to store information such as transactions, customer records, configuration and much more. If you have a database which is not performing very well, you may find that responses in the application are slow, or even time-out, preventing you from running your business effectively. This is easily avoided if you have the right technical procedures in place to ensure this doesn’t happen. Who Is Responsible? K3 offer a cloud hosted database service, but if you are hosting the database on your own infrastructure, then your IT team are responsible for its maintenance. We provide guidance for some products on how your IT Team can keep the database in the best condition (see this article for logged-in users), but if your team does not include database experts, then for a minimal cost we can help you avoid costly issues with availability and performance of your database. How Can K3 Help? K3’s Experts We have product and databases experts ready to provide assurance that your database is performing the best it can on your server. These experts already manage our cloud database hosting service for customers, and so have the product and database technical experience to know what’s best for your application database. Importantly, they know how to tune, but then also maintain that state of tune as your database grows and changes over time. Steps to an Optimised Database The fixed price Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan consist of the stages below. Initialisation Perform diagnostic checks on the database and run tools to optimise it We will also recommend any changes you might need to make on your server (e.g. if it does not have enough space or memory). Validate your Backup Regime Meet Requirements K3 are not responsible for your database backups, but we can make sure it is being backed up to the local server for your own tools to copy off the server, and advise if you need to implement anything additional. Configure and schedule a regular maintenance plan The optimisation tasks will run weekly outside of the hours your business is open. Monitoring and Verification Alerts will be configured from your database to email K3 Support directly If there are issues reported by the database, Support will act upon those tickets from the email quickly which will be raised as a Priority 2 by default. Monthly Inspection Once a month, we will log on to your server and inspect it manually to make sure all optimisation routines are as expected, and that they are having an effect. You will be provided with a brief report giving you the assurance that everything is OK. Annual Health Check At the beginning of each subsequent year since the plan commenced, the same diagnostic steps will be performed as the Initialisation phase which includes recommendations which might have changed due to any changes on the server (some servers host more than the K3 product database, so there are many variables). What Happens if there’s a Problem? The Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan is provided on a fixed price basis per database. If any of the checks find an issue that we need to spend time investigating and resolving, then we will do this on a time and materials basis at the applicable standard rate. An example of this work would be if the database has grown too large and you would like us to archive some data. Additional Options The following can optionally be added to the Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan Database Backups Ensuring your data is backed up in the case of a major incident is essential in any business continuity plan. We will give you the comfort of knowing that backups are being created successfully (at a schedule you define - e.g. every night) which will include making sure that they are the expected size, location, and number of old versions kept. Frequency: Checking backups would be part of the monthly Monitoring and Verification stage described previously. Disaster Recovery Testing If you have subscribed to the optional extra of verifying that database backups are being created, you can also add on that we will do a Disaster Recovery test. This takes your assurance that you are ready for anything to the next level by taking your most recent backup, connecting it to the K3 back office and till programs, and ensuring the integrity of the database backup. Frequency: This can be done as often as required by the customer – we would recommend at least every 6 months. Archiving If you would like to regularly archive your data, we can add this to the Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan. Sometimes a database can grow so large that it impacts performance, even if all the other industry standard maintenance actions are taking place. Data that can be archived includes dormant customers, and transactions older than a certain number of years. The archived data is kept in a separate database for you to backup and keep. Frequency: This can be done as often as required by the customer. We would perform analysis on the database first and provide a recommendation. Next Steps Contact your K3 Customer Success Manager to discuss what best fits your needs, and how we can work together to give you optimum performance and business continuity. Download our brochure if you would like to discuss this with your team.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • What is Database Optimisation?
    • Why Optimise Your K3 Application Database?
    • Who Is Responsible?
  • How Can K3 Help?
    • K3’s Experts
    • Steps to an Optimised Database
  • Additional Options
    • Database Backups
    • Disaster Recovery Testing
    • Archiving
  • Next Steps


What is Database Optimisation?

Database optimisation is the process of using various database manufacturer tools to fine tune their efficiency and maximise the speed at which it works. The tools need configuring, monitoring, and the results evaluated to achieve this.

 

Why Optimise Your K3 Application Database?

In a dynamic business landscape, ensuring fast and reliable application responses from your database infrastructure is paramount. K3 applications have a database to store information such as transactions, customer records, configuration and much more. If you have a database which is not performing very well, you may find that responses in the application are slow, or even time-out, preventing you from running your business effectively. This is easily avoided if you have the right technical procedures in place to ensure this doesn’t happen.

 

Who Is Responsible? 

K3 offer a cloud hosted database service, but if you are hosting the database on your own infrastructure, then your IT team are responsible for its maintenance. We provide guidance for some products on how your IT Team can keep the database in the best condition (see this article for logged-in users), but if your team does not include database experts, then for a minimal cost we can help you avoid costly issues with availability and performance of your database.

 

How Can K3 Help?

K3’s Experts

We have product and databases experts ready to provide assurance that your database is performing the best it can on your server. These experts already manage our cloud database hosting service for customers, and so have the product and database technical experience to know what’s best for your application database. Importantly, they know how to tune, but then also maintain that state of tune as your database grows and changes over time.

 

Steps to an Optimised Database

The fixed price Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan consist of the stages below.

Initialisation

  1. Perform diagnostic checks on the database and run tools to optimise it
         We will also recommend any changes you might need to make on your server (e.g. if it does not have enough space or memory).
  2. Validate your Backup Regime Meet Requirements
         K3 are not responsible for your database backups, but we can make sure it is being backed up to the local server for your own tools to copy off the server, and advise if you need to implement anything additional.
  3. Configure and schedule a regular maintenance plan
         The optimisation tasks will run weekly outside of the hours your business is open.

Monitoring and Verification

  1. Alerts will be configured from your database to email K3 Support directly
         If there are issues reported by the database, Support will act upon those tickets from the email quickly which will be raised as a Priority 2 by default.
  2. Monthly Inspection
         Once a month, we will log on to your server and inspect it manually to make sure all optimisation routines are as expected, and that they are having an effect. You will be provided with a brief report giving you the assurance that everything is OK.

Annual Health Check

At the beginning of each subsequent year since the plan commenced, the same diagnostic steps will be performed as the Initialisation phase which includes recommendations which might have changed due to any changes on the server (some servers host more than the K3 product database, so there are many variables).

What Happens if there’s a Problem?

The Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan is provided on a fixed price basis per database. If any of the checks find an issue that we need to spend time investigating and resolving, then we will do this on a time and materials basis at the applicable standard rate. An example of this work would be if the database has grown too large and you would like us to archive some data.

Additional Options

The following can optionally be added to the Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan

Database Backups

Ensuring your data is backed up in the case of a major incident is essential in any business continuity plan. We will give you the comfort of knowing that backups are being created successfully (at a schedule you define - e.g. every night) which will include making sure that they are the expected size, location, and number of old versions kept.

Frequency: Checking backups would be part of the monthly Monitoring and Verification stage described previously.

Disaster Recovery Testing

If you have subscribed to the optional extra of verifying that database backups are being created, you can also add on that we will do a Disaster Recovery test. This takes your assurance that you are ready for anything to the next level by taking your most recent backup, connecting it to the K3 back office and till programs, and ensuring the integrity of the database backup.

Frequency: This can be done as often as required by the customer – we would recommend at least every 6 months.

Archiving

If you would like to regularly archive your data, we can add this to the Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan. Sometimes a database can grow so large that it impacts performance, even if all the other industry standard maintenance actions are taking place. Data that can be archived includes dormant customers, and transactions older than a certain number of years.

The archived data is kept in a separate database for you to backup and keep.

Frequency: This can be done as often as required by the customer. We would perform analysis on the database first and provide a recommendation.

 

Next Steps

Contact your K3 Customer Success Manager to discuss what best fits your needs, and how we can work together to give you optimum performance and business continuity.

Download our brochure if you would like to discuss this with your team.

title: Verifone connection upgrades
text: If you use Verifone as your card payment device supplier, we may occasionally have to update the software we use to connect with Verifone devices if they update their software. This would be done along with an MStore Core System Upgrade If this is necessary, we will need to log on to every till/POS and install the new "EFT Wrapper" software. Once we have installed the new EFT Wrapper, you will need to logon to the till and make sure that you can press the button to take credit card payments (button name is customisable, so will be different at every site).
description:
If you use Verifone as your card payment device supplier, we may occasionally have to update the software we use to connect with Verifone devices if they update their software. This would be done along with an MStore Core System Upgrade 


If this is necessary, we will need to log on to every till/POS and install the new "EFT Wrapper" software.


Once we have installed the new EFT Wrapper, you will need to logon to the till and make sure that you can press the button to take credit card payments (button name is customisable, so will be different at every site).
